inclusion.criterion: Spina bifida and neuropathic bladder, as determined by the attending physician
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Utilization of intermittent catheterization for bladder management
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: History of 2 or more urinary tract infections (UTIs) in the past year
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Has a known genitourinary pathology beyond neuropathic bladder (e.g. vesicoureteral reflux, bladder stones, kidney stones, etc)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Uses intravesicular agents to reduce UTI (e.g. gentamycin)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Has psychologic or psychiatric conditions influencing the ability to follow instructions
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Participates in another study in which results would be confounded
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of multiple urological procedures, including suprapubic prostatectomy, and currently uses intermittent catheterization for bladder management. He does not have any known genitourinary pathology beyond neuropathic bladder.
